languagetool-linter.enabled.description: Allow to enable languageTool on specific workspaces

languagetool-linter.lt.language.description: A language code like en-US, de-DE, fr, or auto to guess the language automatically (see preferredVariants below). For languages with variants (English, German, Portuguese) spell checking will only be activated when you specify the variant, e.g. en-GB instead of just en.

languagetool-linter.lt.motherTongue.description: A language code of the user's native language, enabling false friends checks for some language pairs.

languagetool-linter.lt.preferredVariants.description: Comma-separated list of preferred language variants. The language detector used with language=auto can detect e.g. English, but it cannot decide whether British English or American English is used. Thus this parameter can be used to specify the preferred variants like en-GB and de-AT. Only available with language=auto.

languagetool-linter.lt.enabledOnly.description: If true, only the rules and categories whose IDs are specified with enabledRules or enabledCategories are enabled.

languagetool-linter.publicFallback.description: Fallback to the public LanguageTool API Service.

languagetool-linter.url.description: URL of LanguageTool server or the path to your local languagetool-server.jar.
